clinical_study.brief_title: Acute Kidney Injury and Renal Recovery After Cardiac Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Acute Kidney Injury and Renal Recovery After Cardiac Surgery - A Retrospective Single-center Study

brief_summary.textblock: Acute kidney injury (AKI) occurs in approximately one-third of patients undergoing cardiac surgery (CS), and represents one of the most significant negative predictors of patient outcome in this population. The investigators sought to examine the prevalence of AKI, renal recovery and development of de-novo chronic kidney disease in all patients undergoing cardiac surgery at San Bortolo Hospital, Italy 2014-2015.

detailed_description.textblock: Acute kidney injury (AKI) occurs in approximately one-third of patients undergoing cardiac surgery (CS), and represents one of the most significant negative predictors of patient outcome in this population. The investigators sought to examine the prevalence of AKI, renal recovery and development of de-novo chronic kidney disease in all patients undergoing cardiac surgery (elective/emergent) at San Bortolo Hospital, Italy during November 2014 - October 2015.

primary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of acute kidney injury using full Kidney Disease Improving Global Outcomes criteria

secondary_outcome.description: Renal recovery is defined as a post-AKI serum creatinine within 25% of the baseline. For patients who will be discharged with higher serum creatinine than baseline, the three months' follow-up serum creatinine will be considered.

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of de-novo chronic kidney disease after cardiac surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Presence of minimum two eGFR measurements <60 ml/min/1.73m2 (CKD-EPI formula) and three months after surgery

arm_group.description: All adult patients undergoing cardiac surgery (elective/emergent) at San Bortolo Hospital, Vicenza, Italy during November 2014 - October 2015

study_pop.textblock: all adult patients undergoing cardiac surgery (elective, urgent and emergent; coronary artery bypass, valve replacements, combined or other surgery, with or without cardiopulmonary bypass) between November 2014 and October 2015 at the Division of Cardiac Surgery, San Bortolo Hospital, in Vicenza, Italy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult cardiac surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Missing data for baseline serum creatinine (defined as a serum creatinine value within 90 to 365 days prior to surgery) or missing serum creatinine values >3 months after surgery (minimum two values)
2. Stage 5 chronic kidney disease (estimated glomerular filtration rate <15 ml/min/1.73 m2 or receipt of chronic dialysis)
